unitTests.mainframe

Class MainframeUnitTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • unitTests.mainframe.MainframeUnitTest

  • public class MainframeUnitTest
extends java.lang.Object
    unit test for the mainframe we must note that we have a regular way to see if the mainframe is aware of some action: we do shutDown and check the backup XML file that the mainframe does of its voters list, parties list and unregistered voters list - if the expected changes are not seen then it is a failure - this is the only way to check the mainframe

      if a voter is marked as 'StartedVote' twice a matched exception will be thrown

      tests that an unregistered voter cannot be mark as someone who is started voting before he is identified first
      void testMarkStartedVote4()
      a test of two unregistered voters such that the first is identified, starting voting and then finishing voting and then the second is identified and then starting voting

      a more complex test of two registered voters who are starting to vote

      tests that even after a voter identified and voted, a second voter cannot vote without identifying first
